instruction: Can you tell me how to format an url in rst?
output:
Yes, I can help you with that. In reStructuredText (RST), you can use the `url` role to format an URL. Here's a detailed step-by-step process:

1. Identify the URL you want to format. Let's assume the URL is "https://www.example.com/this-is-a-sample-url".

2. To format this URL in RST, you would use the `url` role. The format for using the `url` role is:

   `[role]: <URL>`.

3. Replace "role" with the name of the role you want to use for the link (in this case, "url" is a common choice), and `<URL>` with the actual URL you want to link to.

4. So, in your reStructuredText document, you would write:

   `[url]: <https://www.example.com/this-is-a-sample-url>`.

5. The "> " at the end is part of the RST markup. It tells the reader that the text following it is a link.

6. If you want to add a title to the link, you can do so by adding the title after the URL, like this: `[url]: <https://www.example.com/this-is-a-sample-url> "This is a sample title"].

7. The "This is a sample title" part is the title of the link, and it appears as a tooltip when the reader hovers over the link.

So, the final, more detailed, and clear answer is: To format an URL in reStructuredText, you use the `url` role, which is represented as `[url]: <URL>`. Replace "URL" with the actual URL, and if you want to add a title, you can do so by adding " "This is a sample title]" after the URL.
